name: Linter Cop Rules - Future Fixes
description: Rules that would be good to enforce, but we need to plan their implementation first.

rules.justification: All application objects should be covered by at least one permission set in the extension. ~ This rule will be enabled when we create new permission sets.
Use ReadIsolation instead of LockTable. ~ This rule should be fixed, but we need to plan it.
Use SecretText type to protect credentials and sensitive textual values from being revealed. ~ Should be fixed ASAP for security reasons, but we need to plan it.
Do not assign a text to a target with smaller size. ~ Possible overflow - like AA0139. This rule should be fixed, but we need to plan it.
Incorrect number or type of arguments in .Get() method on Record object. ~ Should we fix it e.g. together with possible overflow issues (AA0139 and LC0051)?

Use return value for better error handling. ~ Should we introduce better error handling when getting/finding records? It would be more user friendly, but it would also require more code and changes to existing code.
Option types should be avoided, use enum if applicable. ~ We should consider refactoring old code to use enums instead of option types, but this requires careful planning.

Names must match the allowed pattern and must not match the disallowed pattern. ~ Maybe we can utilize naming patterns in LinterCop.json. Can not get it to work right now. Can we define our naming conventions here?
